title: Skydiving
short_description: Jump from 10,000 feet for the most intense adrenaline rush of your life.
long_description:
Skydiving is often considered the pinnacle of adventure sports. It involves jumping from an aircraft at altitudes ranging from 10,000 to 13,000 feet, experiencing freefall for about 45–60 seconds, and then gliding under a parachute for a gentle descent. The acceleration to terminal velocity (approx 200 km/h) provides an unmatched rush.

In India, skydiving is a relatively new but rapidly growing activity. While it doesn't yet have the widespread infrastructure of Dubai or New Zealand, dedicated drop zones in Narnaul (Haryana), Mysore, and occasionally at other airstrips offer world-class tandem jumps. The most common type for tourists is the 'Tandem Jump', where you are harnessed to a masterful instructor who handles the exit, freefall stability, and parachute deployment. You simply need to arch your back, smile for the camera, and enjoy the ride.

For those who want to take it up as a sport, 'Static Line' jumps and AFF (Accelerated Free Fall) courses are available, allowing you to jump solo after intensive ground training.

locations.summary: The nearest drop zone to Delhi NCR, operated by Skyhigh India, offering jumps from 10,000 ft.
A famous spot in South India offering scenic views of the Chamundi Hills.
India's first certified drop zone, operated largely during camps and festivals.
Occasional camps organized offering jumps with coastal views.
Luxury skydiving experience near Mumbai/Pune, running sporadically.

opening_hours.time_notes: Morning slots are preferred for better visibility and calmer winds.

operating_season.season_notes: Narnaul operates regularly; others are often event-based.

pricing_metadata.disclaimer: Prices are significantly higher than other activities due to aircraft fuel and equipment costs.

safety_guidelines: Maximum weight limit: usually 90kg. Surcharge applies for up to 100kg. Strict no-fly over weight limits.
Medical fitness declaration is mandatory. No heart conditions, epilepsy, or recent surgeries.
Do not consume alcohol 24 hours prior to the jump.
No scuba diving 24 hours before jumping (decompression sickness risk).
Wear tight lace-up sneakers that won't fly off.
major_experiences: The anxiety and thrill of the plane ride to altitude
The moment of exiting the aircraft door
45 seconds of loud, windy, high-speed freefall
The snap of the parachute opening and sudden silence
Steering the parachute (instructors often let you try)

sample_itinerary.one_day: 7:00 AM: Drive to Narnaul Airstrip (2.5 hrs from Delhi). 9:30 AM: Registration and briefing. 10:30 AM: Gear up. 11:00 AM: Board aircraft. 11:20 AM: Jump! 12:00 PM: Debrief, collect video, and depart.

booking_details.suggested_stay: Narnaul is a day trip from Delhi/Gurgaon. For Mysore, stay at any city hotel.
booking_details.how_to_reach: Narnaul is 150km from Delhi. Mysore is 150km from Bangalore.

seo.seo_title: Skydiving in India: Cost, Locations (Narnaul, Mysore) | 2024 Guide
seo.seo_description: Want to skydive in India? Check prices and booking details for Narnaul, Mysore, and Deesa. Tandem jumps start at ₹27,000. Book your thrill now.

highlights: The most intense adrenaline rush available in adventure sports.
Jumps typically from 10,000 feet AGL (Above Ground Level).
Narnaul is the only dedicated international-standard dropzone near Delhi.
Video packages provide a professionally edited movie of your jump.
Strict safety standards comparable to USPA (US Parachute Association) norms.
